And it won't work here. -- What if... they don't want their leader back at all? You said yourself, we don't even have him. Maybe what they really want -- is that we herd our children into stadiums. Put soldiers into our streets. Radicalize people who want to think of themselves as Americans. Bend the law, shred the constitution. Because if we torture him -- and let's call it what it is... You... and I... then the country men like us have sworn to defend. And bled to defend. And died to defend... is gone. And they've won.

dialogues.ELISE:
[1]Hi, I'm Elise Kraft, National Security Council. 
[2]We're all on the same team here, Agent Hubbard. 
[3]It's never the question that's indiscreet, only the answer. 
[4]There's no reason to be nasty. 
[5]Not according to the Cooperation Agreement, Special Order 12333 -- I suggest you reread the paragraph on sharing information. I happen to be well within my authority. 
[6]Unfortunately, not yet. But as soon as I do, I'll -- 
[7]Swell. 
[8]Nice meeting you, too, Special Agent Hubbard. 
[9]Ralph, spare us. 
[10]I never touched him. 
[11]What are you going to charge him with? Jaywalking? I don't suppose we could just have a little chat with him here first? 
[12]You know, Hub... may I call you Hub? If you guys hadn't blown the surveillance, we'd have been able to follow the money. What do you think, Khalil, you would have led us right to your friends, wouldn't you? 
[13]One phone call and he's mine again. You know the number. I have -- 
[14]Oh, come on... Do you have any idea what you're starting here, the kind of shitstorm you're about to -- 
[15]Shouf mountains, right? Shiite or Sunni? 
[16]American University of Beirut? I was there from '79 to 82. 
[17]My father taught Economics. Henry Kraft? 
[18]Such a tragedy. Growing up in that city was... paradise. Like an exotic Paris, wasn't it, Frank --? 
[19]...Yum. 
[20]What's happening out there... 
[21]They've taken another bus, haven't they? Talk to me... 
[22]Listen, these guys are the real deal. 
[23]Yes. 
[24]Yes. And I'm afraid this time they'll blow the bus. 
[25]I... don't know. 
[26]Agent Hubbard. Please. Maybe I can help. 
[27]Oh, God. 
[28]...They're not here to negotiate. 
[29]They were waiting for the cameras. 
[30]They're want the newsies here. They want everybody watching. 
[31]You've got the shooters in place? 
[32]Use 'em. 
[33]Kill 'em now. 
[34]It's lose-lose any way you play it... Do you want to lose little or lose big? 
[35]I didn't make the call. 
[36]Are you alright --? 
[37]Life's too short. 
[38]We ordering in --? 
[39]-- The funeral shroud is the final step in the ritual of self- purification. First a fast, then -- 
[40]...Last March in Iraq, we identified the man we believe responsible for bombing the army barracks last year. In August, he went to Lebanon. Where he was... extracted. 
[41]His name is Sheik Ahmed bin Talal. He's Iraqi. And something of a religious leader. 
[42]He's still being... debriefed. They're not ready to go public with charges. 
[43]Clearly, they're committed. 
[44]In this game, the most committed wins. 
[45]Unless we match their commitment with our own. 
[46]You don't think they've got guys talking to the sheik? Except the sheik isn't talking. 
[47]Believe me, we've put every resource we've got onto that very question. Otherwise... we wait. 
[48]If there's anybody on earth who knows how you feel, it's me. But you've got to let it go. Those people were dead the minute they got on the bus. 
[49]You might consider leaving him alone. 
[50]Play him like a cop and haul him in now and get your arrest, or tag him and let him lead you to the really big fish. 
[51]You ever heard of catch and release? 
[52]Club Fed. 
[53]I still don't understand why we're tipping our hand with him -- 
[54]...Sometimes... in addition to being a nationality, being a Palestinian is also a... profession. A lucrative one. 
[55]Mine. Yours. The Israelis. The Saudis. At one time or another, everybody in the Middle East has slept with everybody else. 
[56]Only professionally. 
[57]No. 
[58]I can't let you do that. 
[59]Samir's been a very important... project of mine for some time... I'm the only one he'll deal with. He's very well-connected -- and extremely high-strung. 
[60]How easy is it to get inside, Frank? How good are your sources in the mosques? How many people you got in Hamas --? 
[61]No surveillance. I've seen your deft touch. 
[62]And I get to see the transcripts. 
[63]And I run him. 
[64]He can't know we're talking. 
[65]Done. 
[66]Not tonight. 
[67]Next time don't be such a smart ass -- 
[68]-- You want to fuck me? Then work with me. 
[69]No? Do we really want to have this conversation again? Do we --? 
[70]I need you to help me. I need you to be strong. As you have always been strong. For both of us. -- Samir? Look at me...

[135]This just came in. 
[136]You alright? 
[137]That's not what I meant. 
[138]Sure. 
[139]That was a pretty crazy thing you did today.

[142]I might. Or I could call Tina. 
[143]Look, I thought Samir'd be an easy recruit. He wasn't. It was crazy but I did what I had to do. You know as well as I do, running an agent can be very... complicated. 
[144]You think I'm trying to run you? 
[145]...You know why I'm here. 
[146]Tell me to leave. 
[147]No. 
[148]He'll fuck it up, the arrogant prick. You ever met anybody so in love with the sound of his own voice? 
[149]Now? With all this going on? He's freaked.

[153]Samir... It's fine, he's cool. 
[154]Liar --! 
[155]You... tell him... what he wants to know. 
[156]He knows. He fucking knows. 
[157]Stop simpering. 
[158]I've got a picture of the two of us, do you remember that picture, Samir? I'm going to post that picture in every mosque in Brooklyn. And then I'm gonna send copies to some friends of mine on the West Bank. You've got family there, don't you --? 
[159]Let go of me -- 
[160]You're good.

[163]Hit him hard. 
[164]I've got to stash Samir someplace safe. Go with God.

[166]At this rate. Too long. The theatre was hit nine hours after we took down the first cell. 
[167]-- Won't work. 
[168]Only in conjunction with sleep deprivation. Needs at least thirty- six hours. 
[169]The neurotransmitters just shut down. 
[170]He knew nothing. 
[171]I ran an Iraqi network for two years. Samir recruited them from among the Sheik's followers. I trained them in the North. Then we played them back into Baghdad, two, three at a time, hiding them in the mosques... 
[172]It was gonna be beautiful. -- And then there was a policy shift -- 
[173]-- The new doctrine was: Iran will be too powerful if Iraq falls apart. And it's not like... we sold them out. Exactly. We just... stopped... helping them. And I wasn't allowed to tell them what was coming down. I was ordered not to tell them. -- And they got slaughtered. 
[174]You've got to understand -- these people... believe. Paradise. Bliss. To us they're just words. But to them... It's very beautiful, actually. And when you look at their lives, the heartbreak... And what do we do? We think, aha, we can take advantage of that. So I quit. I came home. I just can't... do it... anymore. 
[175]What do you mean --? 
[176]I promised we would take care of them. They were working... for us. 
[177]I don't know what you mean. 
[178]And I'm going to have to live with the hell of that for the rest of my life. 
[179]In case you decide to go on walkabout. 
[180]How did you make contact? 
[181]But you're sure he'll show up. 
[182]I need to deliver it in person. Believe me, they'll want to hear what I have to say. 
[183]That's Samir. 
[184]He's terrified. Then again, so am I. 
[185]If he doesn't he knows I'll give him to Devereaux. How's it feel to be on the other end of it? 
[186]This is the endgame, you understand that? If this goes wrong -- 
[187]We're the CIA, something always goes wrong. 
[188]I don't suppose there's any way you would trust me to do this on my own? I thought not. Well, in case it gets hairy, remember... the most committed wins. 
[189]Shhhhhh... If you'd stop whining you'd feel the surveillance. 
[190]Wait for the light to turn yellow and then cross against the traffic. 
[191]Sit. Raise your arm. 
[192]They cannot even dream we are being followed, isn't that what you said? 
[193]...They're going to hit the march. 
[194]Here. Put this on. We don't want our friends sweating too much while they wait. 
[195]"...sweating too much while they wait." 
[196]How soon are they coming? 
[197]What are you doing --? 
[198]I'll tell them when they're here. 
[199]Nobody else is coming, is there? 
[200]You're the last cell. 
[201]How could I have missed the play -- 
[202]-- Just tell me we didn't finance your operation... 
[203]They're going to release him. 
[204]A few months at most. First, they have to bring him to trial, but -- 
[205]-- But... that's what you want, isn't it? Why you've done all this -- 
[206]Samir, the Koran preaches -- 
[207]But it's over, your point's been made, why spill any more blood? Those poor people out there in the street, they're fucking marching for your cause... 
[208]
[209]
[210]Shoot. 
[211]Shoot. 
[212]
[213]
[214]No --!!! 
[215]Is... he... dead? 
[216]...no... regrets...

[218]... Emma... My name... is Emma.
dialogues.FRANK:

[2]Residence or business?

[4]In this traffic, maybe tomorrow.

[8]-- available from The Sharper Image catalogue.

[10]-- And, excuse me, but why do we immediately assume they're Arabs? 
[11]Hub... I think we're all eager to give up our weekends on this. It just occurs to me, has anybody even committed a crime here? I mean, assault with a deadly color? 
[12]-- Omar Abdel Rahman... asshole. 
[13]Under protest. 
[14]-- big orthodontia bills. Someday, you'll understand. 
[15]Where we going? 
[16]You sleep here? Immigration called. 
[17]-- who's trying to score points with his boss, bigtime. 
[18]Not anymore. 
[19]...He means, "dowry." 
[20]The tabac. Sssssss... The territories. 
[21]A '97 Contour. On my Visa. Back home, the security services'd be up this guy's ass with a poker, but what do we do, we let him go. 
[22]Not my first date, Hub. He's taking the BQE. Looks like it's Brooklyn.

[45]...He says he's sorry but he didn't know he was doing something bad. His cousin introduced him to a man who promised him two hundred dollars for his dowry if he'd bring the suitcase to an address in Brooklyn. He's a cut-out. 
[46]Shut the fuck up and go give somebody a parking ticket. 
[47]IAP66. What's IAP66? 
[48]-- Today, Danny... 
[49]Which is... vaporized. 
[50]At the point of issuance. Could be the American Consulate in Tel Aviv. The American Consulate in Amman, Cairo, Alexandria, Riyadh -- all an easy drive from the West Bank -- 
[51]Sorry, boss. Hello, Elise. Mmmm, is that pastrami? Oh, yeah, we made the guy in the picture. 
[52]My people. The last of the unambivalent smokers. Monsters. The toughest motherfucker in Bed-Stuy is a muffin compared to some of these guys. 
[53]His name's Samir Nazhde. Teaches Arab Studies at Brooklyn College. He sponsored Ail Waziri's student visa. And dig this -- his brother blew up a movie theatre in Tel Aviv. 
[54]You're fishing and he's getting visas for bombers. 
[55]Yes, and he's on the next plane for Tunis. 
[56]Go.

[63]"Oh, Danny-boy, the perps, the perps, are call-ing... We need a search warrant on Samir...

[68]Elise. I'm really high strung, too.

[74]So am I --! Hey, Elise... tell us about being a spook? Ever meet Aldrich Ames? Weren't you at the Bay of Pigs?

[94]Kannell was really on.

dialogues.DEVEREAUX:
[1]We're online for exactly two minutes. 
[2]Slow down. 
[3]Gotcha. 
[4]Nobody knows you're here. Not your people. Not even my President. You'll die here alone and be buried unknown -- barring some miracle. 
[5]-- God? GOD? What you eat. Whether you eat. Sleep. Pain. Absence of pain. I decide. I make the day and the night. Even the way you got here -- a hand that reached down from the sky? God? I am your new God. 
[6]Hi. I understand they call you Hub. 
[7]Bill Devereaux. 
[8]82nd Airborne, I know. Same time I was running the -- 
[9]God. Duty. Honor. Country. Where on Capitol Hill, Wall Street, or Hollywood would you find one man who's even paused over one of those words in the last ten years? 
[10]You want me to get to the point. The President's concerned. He's worried that -- have you met him by any chance? 
[11]-- With all the affection for the man I can tell you he doesn't know fuckall about terrorism, or the Mideast, that I don't put on his cue cards. What he's expert in is his own survival. You get my meaning? 
[12]Agent Hubbard -- you look like you think I'm here to take your baby away! 
[13]Which is what I said to the President -- the Army is not some big green police department. Stick with the man on the ground. 
[14]You're sure you're not chasing your own tail, though? 
[15]Old news. 
[16]We can't release him. 
[17]Hub, we can't release him because we don't have him. We never had him. And besides that, he's dead. 
[18]The CIA? The CIA couldn't predict the fall of the Berlin Wall until bricks were hitting them in the head. The Libyans snatched the Sheik -- some sectarian Muslim thing -- I'll explain it next time you have a free week. They killed him. Qaddafi put out disinformation that it was us... Who was your source on this? 
[19]...A woman will never know the Middle East. You're talking about a culture that keeps its women slipcovered. Elise Kraft can't tell a Sheik from the prophylactic of the same name. 
[20]Please, don't let me -- 
[21]Sounds like I should get out of your way. We're there if you need us. Your father well, Elise? 
[22]Top of her game. Well, go get 'em. 
[23]With all respect, Senator, why don't we just stipulate that the President is a dumb son of a bitch so we can all get down to business. 
[24]The Army is a broadsword not a scalpel. You do not want us in an American city. 
[25]We only go if the President invokes the War Powers Act. 
[26]...Twelve hours after the President gives the word we can be on the ground. One light infantry division of ten thousand seven hundred men. Elements of the Rapid Deployment Force combined with Special Forces -- Delta. APC's, tanks, helicopters. And of course, the ubiquitous M-16A1 assault rifle, a humble weapon until you see a man carrying one outside your local bowling alley or Seven- Eleven. It will be noisy, it will be scary and it will not be mistaken for a VFW parade. 
[27]That means civilian casualties. At a minimum it's a drunk private joyriding in a Hummer who runs down an old lady in Greenpoint. At a maximum... Make no mistake. We will hunt the enemy. We will find the enemy. And we will kill the enemy. 
[28]And no card-carrying member of the ACLU is more deadset against it... than I am. Which is why I urge you... no, I implore you not to consider this option. 
[29]What's that? 
[30]That's Anthony Hubbard, FBI. He's the ASAC on the ground up there. They took out the first cell less than 36 hours after bus 87. I suggest we hear what he has to say -- 
[31]-- Amen to that. 
[32]Ahmed Bin Talal. They're still under the impression that we have him. 
[33]To refresh your memory, as I told you last time, it was the Libyans who -- 
[34]Let me give you some free advice, son. Don't get between me and the President. You might break a nail. 
[35]As far as the President is concerned... No, we do not. 
[36]Are you saying the President is prepared to take the necessary steps...? 
[37]Today, with the invocation of the War Powers Act by the President, I am declaring a state of martial law in this city. 
[38]To the best of our knowledge, we are opposed by no more than twenty of the enemy. He is hiding among a population of roughly two million. 
[39]Intelligence tells us he is most likely Arab-speaking, between the age of fourteen and thirty. Narrowing the target to fifteen thousand suspects. 
[40]We can further reduce that number down to those who have been in this country less than six months. Now you have twenty hiding among two thousand. 
[41]If you are one of these twenty young men, you can hide among a population of similar ethnic background. Unfortunately for you, you can only hide there. And that population, in the classic immigration pattern, is concentrated. Right here in Brooklyn. 
[42]We intend to seal off this borough. And then we intend to squeeze it. This is the land of opportunity, gentlemen. The opportunity to turn yourselves in. After sundown tonight any young man fitting the profile I described who has not cooperated will be arrested and detained. 
[43]There is historically nothing more corrosive to the morale of an army than policing its own citizens. 
[44]But the enemy would be sadly mistaken if they were to doubt our resolve. They are now face to face with the most fearsome killing machine in the history of man. And I intend to use it. And be back on base in time for the play-offs... That is all. 
[45]Hub. Good to see you again. 
[46]I am against it. It wasn't my call. 
[47]Your operation had its chance, Hub, and you couldn't get it done. You're down three touchdowns. Time to bring in the first string. 
[48]Are you questioning my patriotism? 
[49]Hub, I want you to take a moment and reflect on my life as a soldier. I have a dozen tropical diseases I'll never entirely get rid of. I set off metal detectors with the shrapnel in my ass. I have watched men die and I have killed. Now I am serving my President and quite possibly not the best interests of my country, but my profession doesn't afford me the luxury of that distinction. I won't question your patriotism but don't you ever again question my command. 
[50]Take a good look around, my friend, and tell me that's still true. But we're not shutting you out. In fact, I can't do it without you, Hub. I need men like you. Men willing to put it on the line like you did in that schoolroom. These stars mean I have been putting it on the line for thirty years... and never made a mistake worth remembering. Don't tell me I made a mistake about you. 
[51]Code blue. 
[52]Code Red. 
[53]-- And his name is Haddad? 
[54]If a mistake's been made we'll fix it. 
[55]And I said we will look into it. 
[56]There's an FBI office in Anchorage, Agent Hubbard. Fuck with me and you'll be learning a hundred and fifty new words for snow. 
[57]The prisoner is being interrogated. 
[58]How long have you been at it? 
[59]How much longer, do you think, before he gives up the other cells -- 
[60]He knows. 
[61]How long before he breaks? 
[62]So -- what other models do we have -- ? 
[63]Shaking. 
[64]What about it, Sharon? 
[65]Works for the Israelis. 
[66]We don't have thirty-six hours. 
[67]Electric shock? 
[68]Water? 
[69]The time has come for one man to suffer in order to save the lives of hundreds 
[70]You're welcome to wait outside. 
[71]I think we have to soundproof the room before we begin. 
[72]Escort him out. 
[73]Let's get this over with. 
[74]Agent Hubbard, do you want to tell me exactly what you mean detaining Colonel Hardwick and six of my CID staff. Because that strikes me as a very peculiar idea of interagency liaison. 
[75]What makes you so sure he was the last cell? 
[76]Sharon is not trustworthy. 
[77]My authority supersedes the civilian judiciary under the decree of martial law. Sorry. 
[78]What's over. 
[79]Release him? 
[80]You don't know shit. Poor suffering Sharon and her poor suffering people. It's called "going native" -- the most elementary error of an intelligence operative and she made it. She had all of you working for her and she was working for them without even knowing it. And now they're getting exactly what they want, which is the Sheik will be back in the mix. But ten times as strong, because now he's the big man who stood up to the Americans. I did what was necessary. I make no apologies. If you think you're going to be able to use that file against me, you know even less about politics than I imagined. 
[81]Because you don't have the balls. Did you expect me to get all weepy with gratitude? You serve your country. Is there anything else?
dialogues.SAMIR:
[1]Are you crazy --? 
[2]Who? I know no one by that name. 
[3]I sign these applications as a matter of course, hundreds of them. Everyone wants to come to the land of opportunity and Baywatch. 
[4]The only ones who didn't were women like you. 
[5]You cannot hold me. I know my rights. I watch American television. 
[6]You let him HIT ME --!! You cannot care about me and let such things happen! 
[7]Sometimes I hate you just because you are so American. It makes me want to hurt you. I think about fucking you and hurting you. 
[8]Don't tell me what I have to do. 
[9]-- Some people just cannot live in the camps. For my brother, it was already like dying. The only thing he lives for is movies. 
[10]-- And then some sheik tells him that, to die for Allah is beautiful. If he does this thing, our parents will be taken care of, and he will live on in Paradise with seventy virgins. Seventy. And my brother, he needs to believe it very much, so he straps ten sticks of dynamite to his chest and goes to the movies... And I become a VIP. It is very confusing. 
[11]You are using me, too! Everybody uses the Palestinians! We are the whores of the Middle East! You make reports about our little talks --? What about fucking me? 
[12]Oh, my God. Oh, my God... 
[13]Listen to that --! Are you listening? They're killing Arabs out there! 
[14]What are you talking about --? The army is here. They're setting up interrogation centers right now. They're torturing people in cellars. 
[15]-- I've got to get out of here. You have to help me -- 
[16]Money... I must have more money... 
[17]I... got it myself. 
[18]She's crazy. They're ghosts. Jinn. They'd never trust someone like me. 
[19]Please... 
[20]I'm afraid of going to hell. 
[21]His name is Tariq Husseini. He runs an auto shop. ...on Commerce Street in Red Hook. 
[22]Ahhhhhh... 
[23]He is Afghani. Ahhhh. He got word to my uncle at the bath-house. You never met him. 
[24]Sharon, they are all dead but the last cell and they are crazy with fear. Just tell me the message and I will pass it on. 
[25]This is not the way to the bath-house. You said to get a key from my uncle so that we -- 
[26]Sharon, please, I beg you. Do not make me do this. If they even dream we are being followed they will kill us. 
[27]What are you doing? 
[28]It is all so... tragic. 
[29]Arab and Jew, side by side. Black and White, Christian and Muslim -- 
[30]-- so American. Can you imagine a better target? 
[31]They'll be here. 
[32]What message do you have for them, Sharon? 
[33]That's right. 
[34]There will never be a last cell. You should listen to the young men in that stadium. It is just beginning. 
[35]It was the money. You believe money is power. Belief is power. 
[36]The world is a wheel. So... what message do you have for me, Sharon? 
[37]Praise God. When will he be free --? 
[38]-- No. 
[39]No. It's not. 
[40]I want you to bleed... as we have bled. 
[41]Do not speak to me of the Koran, woman. You take our leader. A holy man. You put him in prison for preaching the word of God. You must learn the consequences of trying to tell the world how to live. 
[42]Yes. And they, too, will become its martyrs. 
[43]Move away from the door. 
[44]
[45]
[46]
[47]It is God's will.
dialogues.CHIEF OF STAFF:
[1]Ask a question. Get an atlas. 
[2]Respond, sure. But how? 
[3]And if we can't find out --? 
[4]Guys, guys, the President lost a lot of friends last night -- 
[5]-- And his plane lands in two hours. We owe it to him to have a consensus. 
[6]...General? 
[7]But hypothetically... how long would it take you to -- 
[8]I understand that, General. Let us imagine, though, for a moment, that the order has been given. 
[9]I know what the President will say. 
[10]That's exactly why you're the only man for the job. 
[11]And that is --? 
[12]Thank you, Agent Hubbard. I, too, think we should proceed cautiously. Now we've got an Agency briefing prepared... Some of you may not know Sharon Bridger. Sharon was posted in Iraq as part of our covert operations during the Gulf War. -- Sharon... 
[13]And Cell #3? How do we find Cell #3? 
[14]The FBI received another fax. 
[15]Do we? Have him? 
[16]I remember perfectly well what you said last time. Do we? 
[17]I am speaking for the President. 
[18]General, do you know that after yesterday's attack, half the parents in this country kept their children out of school --? ...They're attacking our way of life. It's got to stop. And the President cannot afford to be weak. 
[19]I'm saying, the President is prepared to be... Presidential. 
[20]C'mon in, we're still trying to get the last one down. 
[21]...The President wants this shit over with. There's only one way to do that. Let the Sheik go. 
[22]You think our government operates as a single coherent entity? Devereaux just... pushed the agenda. Of course the President was completely unaware of it. 
[23]Now we can't just let him go. America has to stand tall in the world yadda yadda yadda. So what we do is... We let the American justice system do its work. 
[24]I'll be right up, darling. 
[25]You have kids? They're great. Sometimes you just want to... drug them. 
[26]We don't release him. A judge releases him. You're an FBI man. That's what judges are good at, right? It's not like we've gone after him in proper prosectorial fashion. Kidnaping him. Holding him in isolation. "Fruit of the poisoned tree" -- remember that one from law school? Oh, we'll have a big trial. Everybody'll get their rocks off... But the fact is -- -- the sheik will walk. 
[27]...And this whole episode becomes nothing more than the news cycle before the next news cycle. 
[28]Documentary evidence of Devereaux's whole operation. 
[29]Because you'll know what to do with it. 
[30]Who? 
[31]Ask her.
dialogues.DANNY:
[1]-- He doing her? 
[2]I wonder if she likes bald guys. 
[3]I had a dog like that once. 
[4]The dog works for the CIA? 
[5]-- He's way over his head. 
[6]Hold on, hold on, I'm looking it up -- 
[7]Wait, wait -- Here we go. Student Visa, J-1. 
[8]In his passport. 
[9]Three-fifteen. P.M. When's the last time you ate? 
[10]Fiber thinks they've come up with a piece of the shroud. Egyptian cotton. 
[11]
[12]My department WHAT, ASSHOLE...? 
[13]We bring 'me in, have a talk. 
[14]Where the hell we gonna put sixteen hundred people? 
[15]-- one of the moms was carrying a piece, wounds the guy as he's planting the device. He kills her and locks them all in. Up there in the corner... by the clock. 
[16]-- It's got a timer on it only we don't know how much time is left. 
[17]I don't know. Somebody must have -- 
[18]
[19]NYPD SWAT, this is the FBI. Get that bird the fuck out of there!
dialogues.TINA:
[1]Brooklyn South issued a code blue less than two minutes ago. They think hostages are involved. 
[2]Setting up a perimeter now. 
[3]A bus. 
[4]Rolling. 
[5]Demand for what? You hear any demand? 
[6]Not their style. 
[7]Anyway, isn't Green the color of Islam, not blue? 
[8]Marv Albert? 
[9]Hub, somebody's flashing a government badge over at the warehouse where they're working on the bus. Our tech guys want to know if we're cooperating with any other agencies on this thing. 
[10]...Nice, wasn't it? 
[11]You ever gonna stop by, pick up your things? 
[12]He's down the hall. 
[13]He's on his way up. 
[14]You don't smoke. 
[15]Okay, we've pulled his landing card and his I-94. So now we know he came in three days ago, out of Frankfurt -- 
[16]What we need now is to fill in the time between his arrival and the incident. All known associations, and most of all, we need an address. 
[17]They got earthquakes in Manhattan? 
[18]1942, my father was put into the camps at Manzanar. Until the end of the war. Two years. Now he roots for the Dodgers and swears it could never happen again.
dialogues.MIKE:
[1]You sure this is all they got? 
[2]Not yet... 
[3]Some detective you are. They stopped. 
[4]Hub, we don't have positive ID on anybody. 
[5]You want change, right --? 
[6]You gonna open the door, or what --? 
[7]Jesus, didn't ya hear crime's down seven-percent... 
[8]Same here. 
[9]We got semtex, we got detcord, same stuff as the bus, the whole enchilada...
dialogues.FRED:
[1]Excuse me, sir. I think you should see this. Came in on the Fax. 
[2]The Hamas guy got released in April. 
[3]Really? I wonder if she likes white guys. 
[4]They just found the van. Doesn't look like they're gonna find any prints. 
[5]Floyd Rose. 
[6]I'm on it. 
[7]Sir. They want you in the lab. 
[8]You're saying they're Egyptian?

dialogues.JUDGE FRANKEL:
[1]-- You're telling me that just because some Brooklyn landlord tips you off that he's been paid in cash, you have the right to call in the cavalry -- ! Hub, as far as I know, paying cash is not yet a crime in this country. 
[2]-- You've observed him giving cash to -- 
[3]-- But you have hard evidence linking this apartment to the people that blew up bus 87 --? 
[4]And when you do, you'll get your warrant. 
[5]Meaning? 
[6]Tell me the difference between that and breaking-and-entering? 
[7]Not good enough. 
[8]Waves mean nothing to me; there's been a wave of violent crime committed by black people in this city for the past twenty years, but if you came to me with a plan to put all black people behind bars as a preventative measure I'd send you packing. There's a price to be paid for living in a free society --
dialogues.SENATOR WRIGHT:
[1]How about who's behind who's behind this?

[3]Find out who it is and bomb the shit out of them. 
[4]Anything but leadership. 
[5]The Army then. I've seen the contingency plans. 
[6]Even if that's what our own people are asking for, three to one?
